It seems that you have understood the concept, but the goal needs to be very specific and short-term (not years).
This is good. you have understood the concept. use SMART goals as you progress through your careers.
S: The goal needs to be very specific, to the point, like exactly what is the goal and short-term(in 3 - 6 months, not years).
M: The Measurable is not right. How will you track your progress towards achieving your goal? How will you measure your progress towards achieving the goal?
A :Think how much time you can spend daily. Is it good enough to achieve the goal? Is it really possible to spend this amount of time for the goal?
The R means you need to write how this goal is relevant to your long-term goal. This does not describe how it is relevant to your long term goal.
T: It should be time bound and not open ended. Give deadlines. Give concrete time in days, weeks and months.

All: You may have to see all the videos again to get to a good SMART goal. S: The goal needs to be very specific and short-term (not years).
The Measurable is not right. How will you track your progress towards achieving your goal? How will you measure your progress towards achieving the goal?
For A, think how much time you can spend daily. Is it good enough to achieve the goal? How will you know you could achieve the goal?
The R means you need to write how this goal is relevant to your long-term goal. This does not describe how it is relevant to your long term goal. It should be time bound and not open ended. Give deadlines. Give concrete time in days, weeks and months.
